isis.stitle: AFC 07911 - Engine ECM on DT 466 and 570 Engines May Not Be Programmed Correctly

afc.subject: Engine ECM on DT 466 and 570 Engines May Not Be Programmed Correctly

geninfo.para: Late 2006 engines may not have the correct engine parameters. The engine ECM may not be programmed correctly for transmission type and other engine parameters. This campaign affects only vehicles that have been identified in the attached VIN lists.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the engine is in neutral or park, parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before doing diagnostic or service procedures on engine or vehicle. Read all safety instructions in the SAFETY INFORMATION section of the service manual for this vehicle.

svcprocinfo.para: Vehicles involved in this AFC have been divided into two groups.
Group A is to verify that the correct programming is in the ECM to prevent potential failures of other components and to update the International Electronic Data Base.
Group B is to verify that the vehicle is programmed for the proper transmission and to update International Electronic Database.

svcsubproc.title: Group A
svcsubproc.para: Vehicles in Group A will need to follow these procedures

step1.para: Inspect and record the turbo part number.
Inspect and record the horsepower listed on the emission label.
Using your EZ Tech, do a GET in NETS as a CHANGE PARAMETER from the engine ECM and send to International.
Create an iKNow self service case file and forward to International Vehicle Programming with the above information and they will advise you when the file is ready.
Follow International Vehicle Programming instructions as needed.

svcsubproc.title: Group B
svcsubproc.para: Vehicles in Group B will need to follow these procedures.

step1.para: Using your EZ Tech do a GET in NETS as a CHANGE PARAMETER from the Engine ECM and send to International
Receive the parameters from International and program the Engine ECM.

laborinfo.para: Operation number must appear on all claims.

entry.para: Group A Reprogram and verify components

claims.para: Expense is to be charged to Warranty. Claims are to be submitted in the normal manner, making reference to Authorized Field Change Number G-07911.

It is important that the coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to Items 39 through 44.

To assure this important improvement is made in a timely manner, all claims for G-07911 activity must be submitted by December 31, 2008 or within the normal warranty period for the vehicle, if after December 31, 2008.
